actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-389, by Ms. Slaughter (NY).

Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 1724. All points of order against the conference report and against its consideration are waived. The conference report shall be considered as read when called up for consideration.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 91.
Consideration initiated pursuant to H. Res. 294.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving all points of order against the conference report on the bill (H.R. 1724) to provide for the termination of the application of title IV of the Trade Act of 1974 to Czechoslovakia and Hungary, and against consideration of such conference report.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 1724 (foreign trade).

titles.title: Waiving all points of order against the conference report on the bill (H.R. 1724) to provide for the termination of the application of title IV of the Trade Act of 1974 to Czechoslovakia and Hungary, and against consideration of such conference report.
